column5: Hi all, Headed down the shack after school yet again, absolutely loving that Jack has such a great time there, could not ask for better company at the shack, he is so fun to hang out with. This will be the last time as it is coming off tomorrow, the ice road is deteriorating quickly, tomorrow and the next day its forecast to be +14C. All catch and release but its good to get jack practising using the fish finder and setting the hook. We got a bunch of small ones and Jack got a beauty 19"er as we were just about to shut up shop. It was a 'pyjama day' at school, so thats what Jack is wearing out on the ice, PJ ice fishing, love it.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gAC6dLsZT-0
Another awesome video! So in your opinion do you think it'll be a more normal ice out this year?It will for sure in my neck of the woods.

Great video Limey, thanks for sharing. It's all about the kids. It brought back memories from the eighties when my son and daughter learned. We even had the odd child size boot and leg go in a hole, dry them out and keep on fishing. Again thanks.
I think so its heading that way Its hard to remember a 'normal' ice out, have not had one for a long time here, and i've only been here 8 years.
Thanks for sharing Simon. Great shots of Jack at the shack. Nice walleye too.
